_header: Do way Robin the child will weep
Note: Music, without words, also appears in London, British Library Cotton Fragments XXIX, f. 36.
_description: Fragment to the tenor words to a motet

PULGar119.Transcription: Dou way Robin the child wile wepedou Way Robin…
PULGar119.Note:
Binding fragments. Written in rubric, with musical accompaniment; also
                    with the mostly Latin text.
PULGar119.Editions:
Levy,  Kenneth Jay. 
             “New Material on the Early Motet in England.” 
             Journal American Musicological Society
         4 (1951): 220-239: 225.
Buck,  Percy Carter,
                        ed.  
             The Oxford History of Music
         rev. ed. 7 vols. London: Oxford UP, 1929-38: 3.112.
